item.title: How To Deploy Your Django App Using Docker
item.description: Getting your Django app on the internet is - pardon my language - a pain in the ass. You need to daemonize your app with something like Supervisor, then you need to setup a production ready database, then you need to setup a web-server using the likes of Nginx or Apache. And when it’s all done, you need to setup files and directories to collect and maintain logs from your app.
